title: spack mirror -o fails on tmux package for gcc@4.8.5
body:
(@becker33 just helped me with this and asked that I write it up)

Using the latest spack (ef2e515), I am seeing the following when attempting to build a tmux mirror:

```console
$ spack mirror create -d /tbpool/dsthome/martymcf/mirror/mirror.tmux -D -o tmux %gcc@4.8.5
==> Warning: No known version matches spec: openssl@1.0.2n%gcc@4.8.5 arch=linux-rhel6-x86_64 ^zlib@1.2.11%gcc@4.8.5+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-rhel6-x86_64
==> Adding package libevent@2.0.21 to mirror
```

When I run without "-o", it seems to work around the problem and yields the following output:
```console
$ spack mirror create -d /tbpool/dsthome/martymcf/mirror/mirror.tmux -D tmux %gcc@4.8.5
==> Adding package libevent@2.0.21 to mirror
==> libevent@2.0.21 : already added
==> Adding package pkgconf@1.3.10 to mirror
==> pkgconf@1.3.10 : already added
==> Adding package ncurses@6.0 to mirror
==> ncurses@6.0 : already added
==> Adding package zlib@1.2.11 to mirror
==> zlib@1.2.11 : already added
==> Adding package openssl@1.0.2n to mirror
==> Fetching http://www.openssl.org/source/openssl-1.0.2n.tar.gz
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> openssl@1.0.2n : checksum passed
==> openssl@1.0.2n : added
==> Adding package tmux@2.6 to mirror
==> tmux@2.6 : already added
==> Successfully updated mirror in /tbpool/dsthome/martymcf/mirror/mirror.tmux
  Archive stats:
    5    already present
    1    added
    0    failed to fetch.
```

Expected result: Shouldn't "-o" work here?
